metadata.title: CVE-2021-20263 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the virtio-fs shared file system daemon (virtiofsd) ofQEMU. The new 'xattrmap' option may cause the 'security.capability' xattrin the guest to not drop on file write, potentially leading to a modified,privileged executable in the guest. In rare circumstances, this flaw couldbe used by a malicious user to elevate their privileges within the guest.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20263` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-block-extra - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-guest-agent - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-system - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-system-arm - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-system-common - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-system-data - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-system-gui - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-system-mips - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-system-misc - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-system-ppc - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-system-s390x - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-system-sparc - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-system-x86 - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-system-x86-microvm - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-system-x86-xen - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-user - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-user-static - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
qemu-utils - 1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:5.2+dfsg-9ubuntu3').
